poem:
**Auspicious Inquiry**  

In corridors of ancient tale,  
where gods convene, she seeks  
the ground beneath her feet,  
her gaze — a fierce question.  
Her power not a gift, but a pulse,  
resonating within bone and breath.  
She stands, unshackled,  
not the sculptor's vision,  
but the sculpture itself.  
Unyielding, enduring,  
a hymn unpenned by man.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Mythili Prakash: She’s Auspicious review – a paean to girl power As a child, Mythili Prakash was always puzzled by the myth around the goddess Durga, who was created by a panel of male gods to slay the demon Mahisha. Why should a woman be given her power by a man, she wondered. And it’s something she’s still wondering about.She’s Auspicious is a dismantling of the idea of woman being put on a pedestal, bestowed". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Mythili Prakash: She’s Auspicious review – a paean to girl power As a child, Mythili Prakash was always puzzled by the myth around the goddess Durga, who was created by a panel of male gods to slay the demon Mahisha. Why should a woman be given her power by a man, she wondered. And it’s something she’s still wondering about.She’s Auspicious is a dismantling of the idea of woman being put on a pedestal, bestowed
